meanings.definition: To cut off the head of
meanings.sent1: The executioner will decapitate the criminal.
meanings.sent2: The guillotine was used to decapitate the condemned prisoner.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick went wrong, and he accidentally decapitated his assistant!
meanings.sent4: The decision to decapitate the organization's leadership led to chaos.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tribe's ritual involved decapitating their enemies as a sign of victory.

meanings.sent1: The warrior bravely decapitated the dragon with one swift strike.
meanings.sent2: The executioner was tasked to decapitate the traitor in the town square.
meanings.sent3: The chef jokingly said he would decapitate the vegetables for the salad.
meanings.sent4: The sudden loss of funding threatened to decapitate the research project.
meanings.sent5: The lumberjack's axe was sharp enough to cleanly decapitate the tree trunk.
